alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Hillsborough; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 11:53AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Flood Advisory for Minor Flooding in Poor Drainage Areas for... Southeastern Sullivan County in central New Hampshire... Cheshire County in southern New Hampshire... Northwestern Hillsborough County in southern New Hampshire... West central Merrimack County in central New Hampshire... * Until 1245 PM EDT. * At 1151 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause minor flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will result in minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to one inch of rain has already fallen. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keene, Jaffrey, Peterborough, Winchester, Antrim, Bradford, Dublin, Richmond, Harrisville, Nelson, Gilsum, Marlborough, Rindge, Windsor, Hancock, Swanzey, Marlow, Roxbury, Fitzwilliam and Stoddard. Additional rainfall of one to one and half inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
